description:
After a one-year hiatus, Shinpachi Shimura returns to Edo, only to stumble upon a shocking surprise: Gintoki and Kagura, his fellow Yorozuya members, have become completely different characters! Fleeing from the Yorozuya headquarters in confusion, Shinpachi finds that all the denizens of Edo have undergone impossibly extreme changes, in both appearance and personality. Most unbelievably, his sister Otae has married the Shinsengumi chief and shameless stalker Isao Kondou and is pregnant with their first child.

Bewildered, Shinpachi agrees to join the Shinsengumi at Otae and Kondou's request and finds even more startling transformations afoot both in and out of the ranks of the the organization. However, discovering that Vice Chief Toushirou Hijikata has remained unchanged, Shinpachi and his unlikely Shinsengumi ally set out to return the city of Edo to how they remember it.

With even more dirty jokes, tongue-in-cheek parodies, and shameless references, Gintama' follows the Yorozuya team through more of their misadventures in the vibrant, alien-filled world of Edo.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Samurai
tags.description: Prominently features warriors of medieval Japanese nobility bound by a code of honor.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Anachronism
tags.description: Prominently features elements that are out of place in the historical period the work takes place in, particularly modern elements in a historical setting.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Rakugo
tags.description: Rakugo is the traditional Japanese performance art of comic storytelling.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Yakuza
tags.description: Centered around Japanese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Oiran
tags.description: Prominently features a courtesan character of the Japanese Edo Period.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Cosplay
tags.description: Features dressing up as a different character or profession.

tags.name: Skeleton
tags.description: Prominently features skeleton(s) as a character.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

node.description:
Hideaki Sorachi (空知英秋, Sorachi Hideaki) is a Japanese manga artist best known for his work Gintama.

According to his reply to a manga reader (Gintama Volume 11), he was quite interested in manga during childhood days. However at grade 4 in school he showed his work to his father who promptly laughed at it, after which Sorachi temporarily abandoned his aims of being a manga artist. After graduation, he could not find a job, thus he turned to drawing manga (which he had already learned in university). He was able to gain some recognition through his first work Dandylion and subsequently progressed in his career (the comic is shown in the first volume of Gintama, with a foreword by Hideaki stating that it was his first work). 

In 2003, Sorachi's editor attempted to coax him to create a new series due to a new television program on the Shinsengumi airing on Japanese TV the next year. Yet Sorachi's original idea was to ride on the coattails of the Harry Potter franchise with a series about a school for demon dispellers. After several arguments and an attempt to write the Shinsengumi series, Sorachi gave up, took what he had of the script and twisted it to become the pseudo-historical science fiction series Gintama. (stated in Gintama Volume 1)    

Hideaki Sorachi holds a degree in commercial advertising (again, stated in volume 11). 

(Source: Wikipedia)
_Note: Not to be confused with the [mangaka](https://anilist.co/staff/245226/Yuuichi-Tanaka)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/58120205)

Originating from [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/).

He first came to prominence as the director who overtook [Shinji Takamatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/100152/) on [Gintama](https://anilist.co/anime/918/) from episode 100 onwards. He stepped down from the role after the [2013 movie](https://anilist.co/anime/15335/), but remained as a supervisor for the series until the end.

Also known for series such as [Osomatsu-san](https://anilist.co/anime/21261/) and [Binbougami ga!](https://anilist.co/anime/13535/).

Spyair (stylized as SPYAIR) is a Japanese rock band from Nagoya, Japan, formed in 2005. The band currently consists of Hidefumi "Ike" Ikeda (vocals, former), Yuji "UZ" Nakai (guitar, programming), Kenji "Momiken" Momiyama (bass guitar, leader) and Kenta Sasabe (drums). The band's name, SPYAIR, was determined in one shot by the members, which came from the word spyware, a type of computer virus.

Audio Highs is a Japanese music composer and arranger. They are mostly known for work in Gintama series as music creator.

ecosystem is a Japanese band formed in Osaka. Their alternative and progressive rock swallowed all genres sound with real lyrics, everyday cut and fit the melody mixed with a unique blend. They were an indie band, releasing Jean mini album in 2010, until went major with the single Dilemma in November 2011 that was also the opening theme for the anime Gintama.

node.description: Serial TV Drama (stylized as serial TV drama)is a Japanese band that was formed in 2004, managed by Sony Music Records Inc. and under Steezlab Music. The group consists of five members Hiroki Arai (新井 弘毅 Arai Hiroki), Shotaro Okada (岡田 翔太朗 Okada Shōtarō), Satoshi Tokizaki (鴇崎 智史 Tokizaki Satoshi), Goh Inamasu (稲増 五生 Inamasu Goh), and Futoshi Kondo (近藤 太 Kondō Futoshi).

Prague (プラハ) is a Japanese three-piece rock band formed in 2006. In September 2009, they signed with Sony Music Japan's Ki/oon Records and made their major-label debut. The band first formed when all three members were attending the same music college.   Band Members: Yuta Suzuki (鈴木 雄太) - vocals & guitar Kensuke Ito (伊藤 賢佑) - drums Tsuguhito Konno (金野 倫仁) - bass
FLiP is a rock band from Okinawa. They were formed in 2005 and announced their hiatus in 2016.
